alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued April 09 at 1:26PM PDT until April 11 at 8:00PM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 8 PM PDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 8 inches, except 8 to 14 inches above 7000 feet. Sierra ridge winds gusting near 100 mph with gusts to 50 mph in the lower elevations. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From 5 AM to 8 PM PDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult over the Sierra passes. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday morning and evening commute. Very strong winds could cause tree damage and power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is a 10 to 20 percent chance for thunderstorms Monday.
info.instruction: Even light snowfall causes major travel delays, especially during periods of high traffic volume. Be sure to allow extra time to reach your destination. Leave extra space between vehicles since it takes longer to stop on slick roadways. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
